2002: A midnight barbeque was held.

2004: Kanye West performed at the Bacchanal250 concert.

2006: Bacchanal festivities were compressed from one week to five days, but still included a carnival and “a battle-of-the-bands” concert.

2007: Bacchanal festivities no longer included a carnival or “Olympic games.”

2008: Bacchanal Special Events was formed from the “merger of Bacchanal and Columbia Concerts.” The 2008 concert was the merged entity’s first spring concert event.

2009: Talib Kweli and Vampire Weekend headlined the concert.

20 April 2006

Columbia administration’s “War on Fun” meant a decreased budget and increased regulations on the Bacchanal concert.

13 April 2006

16 April 2009

2010s

2011: Snoop Dogg performed at “ABacchalypse”—a themed Bacchanal.

2 May 2011

2012: In collaboration with groups Live at Lerner and Postcrypt, a “Symposium” week of folk music led up to the Saturday concert, themed “Baccha90s” and featuring Macklemore.

7 April 2011

28 February 2012

13 May 2013

2014: The Bacchanal spring concert was put “under administrative review” that August, and the fall 2014 concert organized by Bacchanal was canceled. According to student organizers, this was due to concerns of sexual harassment and misconduct, but University officials claimed more “general safety concerns.” The spring 2014 concert had faced controversy after headliner Lupe Fiasco displayed an Israeli and a Palestinian flag during his set.

2 May 2011

17 April 2014

2015: The 2015 spring concert, headlined by Big Sean, was “marked by an unprecedented increase in administrative supervision,” had a ticket fee, and faced “repeated threats of cancellation from admin.”

2020: The concert was canceled due to COVID-19 pandemic.

2020s

13 May 2013

2021: Bacchanal was held virtually, featuring A$AP Ferg and Flo Milli.

4 May 2015

2022: Bacchanal was held off-campus at Terminal 5.

2023: Bacchanal returned to campus for the first time since 2019.

31 August 2015

Source: Spectator reporting

Graphic by Jenny Ye

28 November 2001

2000: The weeklong Bacchanal spent “nearly 3 times more money than in the past,” with a total budget of $45,000. It was called “Columbia’s first full-fledged and week-long Spring Fest.”

2000s

There was a performance by comedian Bill Bellamy on Wednesday, a foam party in Lerner Hall on Friday, and a carnival with rides, games, live music, and an additional mystery concert on Saturday.

2001: The weeklong list of activities included a foam party, eating contests, midnight games, a comedy show, and the annual carnival. Columbia Concerts, the organizers of the concert portion, went over $35,000 in debt for the Outkast performance.

3 May 2002

13 April 2006

2002: A midnight barbeque was held.

2004: Kanye West performed at the Bacchanal250 concert.

3 May 2004

2006: Bacchanal festivities were compressed from one week to five days, but still included a carnival and “a battle-of-the-bands” concert.

2007: Bacchanal festivities no longer included a carnival or “Olympic games.”
